reviewText: These are some bada** movies. I love action movies. Well, I love movies in general but action movies are a joy to watch. Crank and Crank 2 are two of the best action movies I've ever seen. They are ridiculous. They are gratuitous, and they are nonsensical for the most part. But they are unique. To this day, I have not seen a movie that is as unique as Crank 1 or 2. I rarely recommend movies to my friends, but I recommend these quite a bit because they are like shots of pure entertainment. Now that they are sold together in one set, there is really no excuse not to buy them. DO IT!

reviewText: This review is for the fomatting - the movies themselves are great.On Crank 2 all that appears of the video is a 4" square that makes the movieunwatchable and the pair of movies uncollectable - was returned.In the reviews some say you need to add a usb flash drive so the disc will detectthe extra space for updates etc and the 4" box will go to normal size for watching.If thats true, that should be explained in the Blu-Ray description.  I wasted a lot of time orderingthe set, screwing around with my blu-ray player and TV (and then finding out it was the disc!),and then ultimately returning the set.  I ended up buying the DVD - couldn't find on Blu-Ray.

reviewText: Don`t watch this movie if you don`t like stytlish crazy no brainer action.it is different from "Rambo" cuz you`ll not see non sense bullets flying over here and there.Crank 1 plays easily on player but for crank 2 you need to update your player.if you`ve ps3 (as it automatically updates itself) then u`ll have no issue but Crank2 always looking for update whenever you insert it and takes good 3-4 minutes searching for`em.its annoying and very bad business dicision as there is no option to disable the search.Be patient and you`ll be rewarded as this movie offer 7.1 DTS master Audio.

reviewText: It is what it is, and what you expect, from a Jason Statham starring action flick. Lots of stunts, lots of jump cuts in the editing, and not an overly intellectual premise... exactly what I wanted in an essentially mindless action flick. Not that I am disparaging the movie in the least, I dug it actually quite a bit. It just isn't hamlet... and if you are looking for a really involved developed story... this isnt it. Straight forward action with a basic premise.
summary: Typical rock em sock em Statham action flick

reviewText: Movies were in perfect condition, but I had some problems getting Crank 2 to work. I read the reviews saying Crank 2 wouldn't work in the older blu ray players. But I just bought a new blu ray player a couple months ago, so I didn't think it would affect me. I was wrong, all I saw was a little 6x6" picture on my screen, exactly how the other reviewers had described. Even though the comments suggested a firmware update, that was not the solution. I put it in my PS3 I bought in 07', which I havent updated since 09'. It worked perfectly in my PS3, It still pisses me off it wont work in my brand new blu ray player. But it works in my PS3 so it's not a problem for me. Otherwise I'd give it 5 stars. The movie itself was pretty unbelieveable to the point it was dumb. But the violence and nudity more than made up for the bad story.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I myself have not experienced any issues watching either film as numerously complained about all over the web and on most of the other reviews here. Crank 1 takes itself a touch more seriously while 2 just completely blurs the lines between reality and goofiness. I love both films for what they are, adrenaline packed action with an unrealistic story and concept.The issue most people are referring to is that with older players the crank 2 disc works fine, but with newer ones that do not have a built in hard drive to receive updates the disc will sometimes not work. Or will work in weird ways. It seems this update forces itself to download and then if it isn't able to be received it wonks out the film. Two things to clear this up, first off get your blu-ray player online with the most up to date firmware installed, and secondly if the blu ray player doesn't have a hard drive built in. Such as my own (Samsung BD-c5500). Then just plug a USB stick of 1gb or higher on any of the player's ports and it will download the updates and work fine for any BD-Live enabled film including this one.I hadn't received any updates at all when putting in this disc, and cannot even find any of the LG-Live/BD-Live content. Where on a disc like the expendables the content is in plain site, either they removed it for future prints, or perhaps I'm just not looking where I am supposed to?The picture quality and sound is excellent, the movies are lots of fun but very mature in nature and not meant for kids or people who can't handle, nudity, lot's of cursing, and violence.I give this set an A grade wise. Statham kicks A** in these ;)
summary: No issues, looks great, great fun!
